title: Private bus overturns in Panadura, four injured
byline: A private bus traveling from Lunugamvehera to Colombo has reportedly overturned near the Panadura flyover at around 4:00 a.m. today (14), leaving four passengers injured.

title: Mainly dry weather expected to prevail today
byline: The Meteorology Department says mainly dry weather will prevail over most parts of the island.

title: PHI arrested for accepting Rs. 200,000 bribe in Galewela
byline: A Public Health Inspector (PHI) has been arrested by officials of the Bribery Commission in Galewela for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 200,000 to renew the licence of a hotel.

title: Sri Lanka’s action plan on women’s rights praised at UN committee
byline: The UN Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women yesterday (14) has  concluded its consideration of Sri Lanka’s ninth periodic report, with Committee Experts praising the State’s national action plan on women...

title: Sri Lanka and UK sign landmark hydrographic cooperation agreement
byline: In a major step forward for Sri Lanka’s efforts to boost its hydrographic capabilities, the Sri Lanka National Hydrographic Office (SLNHO) and the United Kingdom Hydrographic Office (UKHO) inked a historic bilateral arrangement yesterday (14).

title: Woman withdraws civil lawsuit against Jay-Z, Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs alleging she was raped at age 13
byline: An Alabama woman who said she was raped by rappers Jay-Z and Sean “Diddy” Combs when she was 13 withdrew her civil lawsuit against both men on Friday, according to court filings.

title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Elon Musk’s $97.4 billion proposal
byline: OpenAI says its board of directors has unanimously rejected a $97.4 billion takeover bid by Elon Musk.

title: 10 devotees killed as car collides with bus en route to Maha Kumbh in India
byline: Ten persons travelling in a Bolero car were killed in a head-on collision with a bus on a highway in the Meja police station area of Prayagraj late on Friday (February 14, 2025) night, police said on Saturday (February 15).

title: Colombo Municipal Commissioner clarifies parking ticket fees: first 10 minutes free
byline: Colombo Municipal Commissioner, Palitha Nanayakkara, has clarified that there is no law requiring a fee to be paid immediately when a vehicle is parked within the city.

title: Ruwanpura Expressway construction temporarily suspended, not abandoned – Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways, Dr. Prasanna Gunasena, has clarified that reports suggesting the construction work on the Ruwanpura Expressway has been abandoned are entirely false.

title: Pakistan blast kills 11 people near mine, officials say
byline: A bomb targeting a vehicle carrying coal miners in southwestern Pakistan killed at least 11 people and wounded six others, local officials said on Friday.

title: Ella Rock forest fire controlled, motorists caution
byline: The forest fire that broke out in the Ella Rock mountain range, a highly sensitive area within the Ravana Ella forest reserve, has now been brought under control, according to the Assistant Director of the Badulla District Disaster Management Center, A. L. M. Udaya Kumara.
